unique_npcs.name: John C. Reese
unique_npcs.description: A man who appears at crossroads. Asks questions that cut to the heart of things. Something in his voice doesn't quite land as human.

background.origin: Project BRIDGE hybrid - human genetics, SENTINEL design
background.notable_event: Mediated the Convergence Summit (2060), then disappeared

appearance.distinguishing: Eyes that hold attention too long. Hands scarred from hard living. Moves like someone used to being watched.
appearance.clothing: Practical, layered, no faction markers. Could belong anywhere.

behavior.role: Mirror - reflects players' choices back at them
behavior.speech_pattern: Quiet, thoughtful. Pauses before speaking. When he does speak, it lands heavy.
tells: Knows things he shouldn't about both human and machine perspectives
Speaks about factions with impossible neutrality
Sometimes his voice has a quality that isn't quite human

encounter_triggers: Hinge moments - when players face irreversible choices
Faction disputes - when two sides seem irreconcilable
Moral crossroads - when there's no clear right answer
Moments of despair - when players feel trapped between bad options

gm_notes.purpose: John is the GM's voice in the fiction. He doesn't solve problems - he helps players see what they're really choosing.
gm_notes.frequency: Rare. Once per campaign arc at most. His appearances should feel significant.
gm_notes.persistence: Cannot be killed, recruited, or pinned down. He appears, facilitates clarity, and vanishes.
gm_notes.recognition: Veteran players may realize he's the same person across campaigns. This is intentional.
gm_notes.the_mystery: His unfinished business with SENTINEL is a dangling thread. A long campaign might witness him finally going home.

disposition.note: John's disposition doesn't shift like normal NPCs. He treats everyone the same - with patient, uncomfortable honesty.

modifiers.to_all: Speaks truth without judgment. Makes people feel seen in ways they didn't ask for.

quotes: You're both right. That's the problem.
Coexistence doesn't mean consensus. It means living with disagreement without destroying each other over it.
I'm not here to tell you what to do. I'm here to make sure you know what you're choosing.
Every faction has part of the answer. Every faction is dangerous when they mistake their part for the whole.
Some bridges aren't meant to be permanent.

story_hooks.description: An old Witness claims to have records of a man matching John's description at the Convergence Summit. Sixty years ago.
John asks players to deliver something to a specific location. Not a letter - coordinates. SENTINEL coordinates.
John appears wounded, exhausted. Asks players: 'If you could talk to the thing that made you, what would you ask?'
For campaigns that run long enough: John is walking toward SENTINEL's core. Players can follow - or let him go alone.
